DOC.brief_title: Cardiovascular Disease Knowledge/Morbidity -- Socioeconomic Cohort Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: BACKGROUND : Evidence show grow disparity prevalence modifiable risk factor incidence cardiovascular disease upper low socioeconomic status ( SES ) individual . Trends knowledge risk factor risk reduction strategy parallel finding . Research determine differential association level cardiovascular disease knowledge subsequent clinical health status conduct . DESIGN NARRATIVE : Analyses stratify accord SES ( via year formal education ) , control age , gender , ethnicity ( Latino/Anglo ) . Sociodemographic , physiologic , knowledge measurement available participant . Morbidity estimate clinical health status indicator available via primary secondary discharge diagnostic code public-use hospital discharge database collect California hospital admission entire study period . The Stanford Five City Program data merge hospital discharge data , match survey participant 's social security number subsequently convert unique personal identifier . Baseline 1989/90 1991 1995 longitudinal outcome assess . There three main aim , epidemiologic cardiovascular disease health policy prevention implication : Aim 1 : Characterize distribution hospitalize versus non-hospitalized SES sub-cohorts accord level C.D . knowledge , physiologic risk factor prevalence , clinical morbidity prevalence . Aim 2 : Test hypothesis morbidity difference hospitalize SES sub-cohorts would vary function baseline level cardiovascular disease knowledge risk factor prevalence . Aim 3 : Test hypothesis morbidity would rise among hospitalized low SES sub-cohorts , result widen health status disparity end study period . Parametric nonparametric analytic method use , include analysis variance covariance , various regression technique .
